title: Steam locomotive
summary: A steam locomotive is a rail vehicle that provides the force to move itself and other vehicles by means of the expansion of steam.[1]: 80  It is fuelled by burning combustible material (usually coal, oil or – now rare – wood) to heat water in the locomotive's boiler to the point when it becomes gaseous and its volume increases 1,700 times. Functionally, it is a steam engine on wheels.
